input:
AS Roma 4 - 0 Udinese

13:02 Caption: Edin Dzeko (AS Roma) sends a lofted cross into the box which is headed clear. Good work from AS Roma as they win a corner.

17:15 Event: Indirect free-kick by Udinese
17:52 Caption: Duvan Zapata (Udinese) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
18:07 Event: Foul by AS Roma
18:10 Event: Indirect free-kick by Udinese
18:30 Caption: Ali Adnan (Udinese) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well-organized defence.

20:33 Event: Clearance by AS Roma
21:01 Event: Shots off target by AS Roma
21:02 Event: Ball out of play
21:11 Caption: Bruno Peres (AS Roma) probably spotted the goalkeeper off his line, but he misdirected his long-range shot as it went a few yards wide of the right post.
21:26 Event: Clearance by Udinese
22:05 Event: Offside by Udinese
22:14 Caption: Silvan Widmer (Udinese) releases a low pass from just outside the box in an attempt to find his teammate, but one of the defenders calmly averts the threat.
22:25 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma
22:33 Caption: The linesman raises his flag for offside before Duvan Zapata (Udinese) heads on.
22:50 Event: Ball out of play

25:49 Event: Indirect free-kick by Udinese

26:17 Event: Ball out of play

26:54 Event: Shots off target by AS Roma

27:58 Caption: Ali Adnan (Udinese) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat.

28:36 Event: Indirect free-kick by Udinese

29:34 Caption: Leandro Paredes (AS Roma) works the corner short.
29:42 Event: Ball out of play

30:28 Event: Clearance by Udinese

31:22 Event: Foul by Udinese
31:31 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma
31:33 Caption: Samir (Udinese) commits a foul and Marco Di Bello immediately signals a free kick.
32:23 Caption: Neat passing move from AS Roma in order to create new attacking opportunities.
32:28 Event: Shots on target by AS Roma

33:11 Event: Ball out of play
33:43 Event: Corner by Udinese

34:35 Caption: The linesman raises his flag. Edin Dzeko (AS Roma) is adjudged offside.
34:45 Event: Indirect free-kick by Udinese
36:06 Caption: Kevin Strootman (AS Roma) and Edin Dzeko attempt to exchange short two-yard passes, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball.
36:10 Event: Shots off target by Udinese
36:11 Event: Ball out of play
36:18 Event: Clearance by AS Roma
36:26 Caption: Excellent touch by Rodrigo De Paul (Udinese)! He latches on to a precise pass on the edge of the box but miskicks and the ball goes well wide of the right post. Poor effort.
36:34 Event: Ball out of play
36:41 Event: Throw-in by AS Roma
36:59 Caption: An attempted cross from Radja Nainggolan (AS Roma) is cleared.
37:08 Event: Foul by Udinese
37:17 Caption: Marco Di Bello has a clear sight and sees a foul from Seko Fofana (Udinese).
37:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma

38:45 Caption: Leandro Paredes (AS Roma) delivers a poor cross from a free kick as one of the defenders comfortably clears it away.
39:04 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma

40:52 Event: Shots off target by AS Roma

42:06 Event: Ball out of play
42:08 Caption: Mohamed Salah (AS Roma) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders. The ball goes out for a corner. AS Roma can continue in their attacking effort.
42:32 Caption: Mohamed Salah (AS Roma) works the corner short instead of sending the ball into the penalty area.
43:01 Caption: Orestis Karnezis makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded by Edin Dzeko (AS Roma) after a cross from the side.
43:05 Event: Throw-in by AS Roma
44:09 Caption: Stephan El Shaarawy (AS Roma) passes the ball from the edge of the box in order to find his teammate, who is in a good scoring position, but the defender blocks the pass and spanks the ball to safety.
44:48 Event: Ball out of play
44:50 Event: Clearance by AS Roma
44:57 Caption: A pass by Ali Adnan (Udinese) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end.
45:15 Caption: Bruno Peres (AS Roma) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Orestis Karnezis intercepts the ball.
45:55 Caption: Rodrigo De Paul (Udinese) finds some space inside the box and latches on to a brilliant cross, but he wastes his chance as his shot goes way wide of the left post.
46:10 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
46:59 Caption: The supporters are far from satisfied with this tedious game. The players will have to try much harder to provide them with worthy entertainment. The home team were mostly in control in the first half. The home side are keeping possession of the ball with some short passes, while the visitors are waiting to open up their defence and hit them swiftly on the break.

Second Half:
00:00 Caption: There will be a minimum of 1 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: The whistle blows and Marco Di Bello starts the second half.
00:03 Event: Kick-off by AS Roma

00:46 Event: Clearance by Udinese

36:18 Caption: Radja Nainggolan (AS Roma) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. AS Roma earn a corner.
36:37 Event: Corner by AS Roma
36:50 Event: Shots on target by AS Roma
36:50 Event: Goal by AS Roma
36:50 Caption: Mohamed Salah (AS Roma) swings in a dangerous cross from the resulting corner kick, but none of his teammates manage to outjump the defence.
36:58 Caption: It's in the back of the net! Radja Nainggolan is the provider as he slips the ball to Edin Dzeko (AS Roma) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 3:0.

37:51 Event: Ball out of play

38:10 Caption: Mohamed Salah (AS Roma) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Orestis Karnezis, who pulls off a stunning save!
38:44 Event: Shots on target by AS Roma
38:45 Event: Shots on target by AS Roma
38:46 Event: Goal by AS Roma
38:50 Caption: Goal! The rebound fell to Mohamed Salah (AS Roma) and he fired home from close range. The score is 4:0.
39:23 Event: Kick-off by Udinese
39:35 Event: Shots off target by AS Roma
39:36 Event: Ball out of play
40:27 Caption: A precise low pass is received by Mohamed Salah (AS Roma), who makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box, but his poorly placed shot sails well wide of the left post.
40:34 Event: Shots off target by Udinese

41:32 Caption: 25:11 – the total goal attempt statistics.
41:56 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma
42:01 Caption: Adalberto Penaranda (Udinese) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Marco Di Bello stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning.
43:17 Event: Foul by Udinese
43:31 Event: Indirect free-kick by AS Roma
43:36 Caption: Poor challenge! Adalberto Penaranda (Udinese) is penalised for tripping and Marco Di Bello blows his whistle. A free kick has been awarded to AS Roma.
44:10 Caption: Kevin Strootman (AS Roma) takes the free kick and immediately restarts play with a short pass.
45:32 Caption: AS Roma seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.
46:44 Caption: That's a well-taken pass by Adalberto Penaranda (Udinese). He unleashes a strike from the edge of the box, but blazes it high over the bar.
47:21 Caption: A clumsy foul by Bruno Peres (AS Roma) and Marco Di Bello blows his whistle. Udinese are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
48:05 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
48:59 Caption: The game wasn't exhilarating, but it wasn't totally boring either. There were a few nice moments from both sides. The home side were superior in this game. It was obvious that the hosts tried to outplay their opponents with some passing football, while the visitors focused on counter-attacking play.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
It was a memorable night at Stadio Olimpico as AS Roma delivered a commanding performance against Udinese, securing a dominant 4-0 victory in front of their home crowd. The game commenced with Udinese kicking off, but it didn't take long for AS Roma to establish control.

Within the first minute, AS Roma executed a clearance, and shortly after, Udinese committed their first foul of the evening, leading to an indirect free-kick for AS Roma. The game witnessed a series of throw-ins and clearances within the initial minutes, indicating a cautious start from both sides. However, the early exchanges lacked significant opportunities as both teams tried to find their rhythm.

In the 4th minute, a foul from AS Roma handed Udinese an indirect free-kick, which came to nothing as the ball soon went out of play. AS Roma's defense was solid, clearing threats decisively and maintaining control over Udinese's attacks. By the 6th minute, an offside call against AS Roma halted their forward movement momentarily. Udinese responded with an indirect free-kick and a clearance soon followed.

The first significant chance came in the 9th minute when AS Roma managed to hit a shot on target, but Udinese's defense remained sturdy, continuously thwarting the home side's attempts. Edin Dzeko, determined to make an early impact, received a brilliant pass inside the penalty area in the 15th minute. His shot, though powerful, flew just over the crossbar, a narrow miss that electrified the fans.

From the 17th minute onwards, both teams engaged more aggressively, with Duvan Zapata of Udinese managing a well-placed shot inside the box, only to be brilliantly blocked by AS Roma's defense. A few minutes later, Ali Adnan sent a hopeful cross into the box, but the AS Roma defenders were well-organized and cleared the threat.

As the half progressed, AS Roma began to assert more control. In the 26th minute, after a series of corner attempts, Stephan El Shaarawy hit a shot from outside the box, but it was blocked. Konstantinos Manolas further headed the ball from a corner, but his effort went well wide of the target. The match saw multiple instances of AS Roma making promising attempts, yet being denied either by the Udinese defense or missing the mark.

The 31st minute showed Kevin Strootman and Edin Dzeko's attempt to break the deadlock through short passes, but the Udinese defense intercepted and disrupted their rhythm. However, the ever-persistent AS Roma continued to press on. Stephan El Shaarawy had another shot on target at 32 minutes, saved by Orestis Karnezis, showcasing the relentless attacking from the home side.

Moments later, another wave of action hit when Mohamed Salah sent various crosses into the penalty area. Each effort either ended up with Udinese's defense clearing the ball or missed by the Roma attackers. Salah, in particular, was a constant menace down the flanks, whipping in dangerous balls that kept Udinese on high alert.

AS Roma's determination finally paid off just before half-time. The 43rd minute saw a stunning save by Karnezis off Edin Dzeko's header, but the relentless pressure eventually proved too much for Udinese to handle. By half-time, AS Roma had made their intentions clear, yet the score remained 0-0. The supporters showed signs of impatience, craving an outcome reflective of AS Roma's dominance on the ball and their numerous forays into the final third.

The second half began with an emphatic start from AS Roma. Within the first five minutes, Radja Nainggolan had a good opportunity, but his strike wasn't accurate and went over the bar. The urgency in AS Roma's play was palpable as they sought to capitalize on their first-half dominance. However, a significant event occurred in the 53rd minute when Udinese's Thomas Heurtaux got injured and had to be substituted by Gabriele Angella. This change did little to deter Roma’s ambition.

The turning point came in the 68th minute when Udinese was penalized for a foul inside the box, awarding AS Roma a crucial penalty. Diego Perotti stepped up with remarkable composure and converted, sending Orestis Karnezis the wrong way and slotting the ball into the center of the goal. This breakthrough goal significantly lifted the spirits of the home fans and rattled Udinese's morale.

Shortly after, another penalty was awarded to AS Roma due to a foul by Udinese's Badu. Perotti, oozing confidence from his previous successful attempt, took the responsibility again. Mirroring his earlier effort, he slotted it past Karnezis, solidifying AS Roma's lead to 2-0 by the 76th minute. The floodgates seemed to have opened, and Roma's attack grew bolder with each passing minute.

AS Roma continued pressing, and it bore fruit. In the 77th minute, an excellent set-piece delivery from Mohamed Salah found Edin Dzeko, who made no mistake, steering the ball home from close range, making the scoreline 3-0. The celebration was jubilant as it demonstrated the synergy within the team.

Barely a minute later, the exuberance of AS Roma knew no bounds as they netted their fourth of the night. Salah’s endless efforts to breach Udinese's defense finally paid off as he pounced on a rebound, firing home from close range. This quick double punch from AS Roma left Udinese with little hope of recovery.

Despite a few late attempts from Udinese, including Adalberto Penaranda's hopeful strike and Francesco Lodi's corner delivering no substantial pickup, the match ended with AS Roma firmly in control. The statistics of 25 shot attempts to 11 from Udinese emphasized the dominance of AS Roma throughout the match.

As the referee blew the final whistle, officially endorsing the resounding 4-0 victory for AS Roma, the players were greeted with thunderous applause and cheers from their loyal supporters. The team’s performance showcased their intent and capability, asserting themselves as formidable contenders in the league.

The narrative of the match was more than just goals; it was about strategy, persistence, and an unyielding desire to win. AS Roma's tactical execution, especially in capitalizing on set-pieces and penalties, highlighted their sophisticated approach. Mohamed Salah, with his relentless runs and precise crosses, Edin Dzeko's clinical finishing, and Diego Perotti’s ice-cold penalties were pivotal in scripting this memorable victory.

In summary, AS Roma's 4-0 triumph over Udinese was a display of sheer footballing prowess and an embodiment of teamwork, strategy, and execution. The home crowd left the Stadio Olimpico with joy and pride, hopeful that this resolute performance was a precursor to a season of success and glory.
